Let’s revisit a post from last September, with the same invitation for any of you lunatics to show us some scientific data to support your primitive and naïve view on the subject. Or jon could just do some more name calling and wink a lot. Governor Perry Blows Hot Air on Global Warming At the first Republican Debate, Rick Perry made the following statements: "The science is not settled on this (global warming). The idea that we would put Americans' economy at jeopardy based on scientific theory that's not settled yet, to me, is just, is nonsense…" …perhaps the real reason that Governor Perry, and like-minded laissez-faire proponents, deny global warming and contend that government regulations hold back business and plea for smaller government and self-regulation is this; Texas, the center of America’s oil and gas industry, also is the number one emitter of the major green house gas – carbon dioxide – in this country today. Is it any wonder, then, why he disavows the findings of the National Academy of Sciences, as well as the overwhelmingly accepted consensus of 18 scientific organizations, whose statement to The Senate concluded: “Observations throughout the world make it clear that climate change is occurring, and rigorous scientific research demonstrates that the greenhouse gases emitted by human activities are the primary driver.” * Let us not let political hot air blow away scientific fact for the sake of short term profit at the expense of long term civilization. Yes, business and the economy are important, but not at the expense of our children and future generations. echo2165 * Letter to the Senate, October 29, 2009 from The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and U.S. Global Change Research Program, American Association for the Advancement of Science, American Chemical Society, American Geophysical Union, American Institute of Biological Sciences, American Meteorological Society, American Society of Agronomy, American Society of Plant Biologists, American Statistical Association, Association of Ecosystem Research Centers, Botanical Society of America, Crop Science Society of America, Ecological Society of America, Natural Science Collections Alliance, Organization of Biological Field Stations, Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, Society of Systematic Biologists, Soil Science Society of America, University Corporation for Atmospheric Research. (BTW, there are even more International Organizations that acknowledge this conclusion, as well. Of course, this is critically and peer-reviewed science, not unsubstantiated propaganda from individuals funded by special interests. I encourage and invite opposing views with accompanying sources, not the usual "there's just as many people who say global warming is marlarkey" - if there are, please show us. If you can't, please stop lying to your fellow citizens for your own gain.

"AT&T Dividends exceed earnings. Payout is over twice the 2011 earnings per share. Maybe 2011 was a bad year. Same situation for Verizon." Seeking Alpha 8/23/2012 "Billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller's 5 New Dividend Picks Stanley Druckenmiller is one of the world's most renowned hedge fund managers. While at the helm of Duquesne Capital, a macro hedge fund, he generated returns averaging 30% per year between 1986 and 2010. After closing his investment company, Druckenmiller opened a family office to manage some of his wealth. AT&T is another U.S. communications giant and another new holding in Druckenmiller's fund. The position was also valued at $28 million at the end of the second quarter. The company has a market capitalization of $211 billion. AT&T is a dividend aristocrat that has increased dividends for 28 years in a row. It pays the highest dividend yield among Dow Jones 30 index constituents. AT&T's dividend yield is 4.7% and its payout ratio is 72% of free cash flow. The company boosted dividends at an average rate of 4.6% per year over the past five years. Its peer Verizon Communications pays a dividend yield of 4.5%, while Sprint Nextel does not pay dividends. AT&T has a free cash flow yield of 2.6%, ROE of 4.1%, and ROIC of 2.8%. The company's forward P/E is slightly below those of the telecommunications industry and the key competitor Verizon. The stock is up 31% over the past year. Adage Capital has nearly $290 million invested in the company. In a recent article, we took a closer look at AT&T and Verizon Communications as dividend plays." By the way, per the same piece, he also bought VZ. What a poor investor he must be. I was wondering if Stanley bought your shares?

winholder, the fact is that many jobs have been created as opposed to being lost when we were in the Great Recession. The unemployment rate is determined by how many people are looking for a job and can't get one. The reason why the unemployment rate is so high is because every year more people graduate high school or college and start looking for jobs. In addition more people look for jobs when they think they have some chance of finding one. I personally know people who could not find a job during that Great Recession but fortunately are now employed. I also know a man who is a supervisor of a store that sells new and used cars and he said that the company he works for was going through the worse time that he had ever seen. Now thank goodness,they have been doing well.

The more the price goes down, the better the buy. I dropped $140 at our Target last night. The store was very busy, possibly more than usual because of kids getting ready for school. However, this store is always busy. I think the reason we had so many days on the downside was because of investors cashing out from recent gains. With Canada coming on stream next year, I think it should make for higher prices - unless the whole ecnomy goes over the cliff after the next election. In summary, I don't concern myself with this company - not yet anyway. I hold 2,500 Target shares in a joint account and 500 shares in a Roth account. There may come a time to reassess everything. I did pick up 1000 shares of Silver Wheaton, SLW, recently as a hedge against future problems. Now if we could just get a decent bunch in government to represent us, we would have it made. I have an analyst acquaintance in one of the federal reserve banks and he said there is so much damage done to our economy that it wouldn't matter who wins the election. That is not a good sign if he is right. He is pretty astute so he probably is.

Message.Title: ROMNEY HIT A HOME RUN TODAY IN NEW MEXICO
Message.Msg: He stopped in three towns in nm today, one of them being hobbs a capital oil town. he got a standing ovation when he told the oil industry that he would allow production of oil and gas on federal lands. not many people know this but the oil companies have to bid on these federal oil leases and drill withing a certain time frame. many of these leases are ready to expire and the govt. Will not make a refund even though they imposed an impact study on these area's that takes 3-5 years. groosly unfair to pay for a lease and not be able to drill on it...
"assault" is how people not in the irrelevant backwoods of Vaginny spell it. You're an idiot.

Still laughing over this one. You cannot even construct a sentence without a spelling or grammatical error and you actually think you have an opinion on education. Silly, irrelevant little pretend man. You're an idiot.

Topic.Title: ROMNEY HIT A HOME RUN TODAY IN NEW MEXICO

Message.Msg: America's biggest export currently is oil/gas. So--how will more production benefit us? What, we export more?

Topic.Title: ROMNEY HIT A HOME RUN TODAY IN NEW MEXICO

Message.Msg: America's biggest export currently is oil/gas. So--how will more production benefit us? What, we export more? OUR NUMBER ONE SUPPLIER OF OIL AND GAS TO THE US IS CANADA, FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY MEXICO. VENZUELA IS NOT FAR BEHIND MEXICO. FORGOT WHERE LIBYA COMES IN THERE BUT WE STILL RECEIVE OIL FROM THEM.
